backgroundInformationList.description: Declaration of Surplus Property - 275 Merton Street

noticeDescription:
NOTICE is hereby given that in accordance with the City of
Toronto’s real estate disposal By-law, on June 3, 2024, the
following City-owned parcels of lands were declared surplus:


275 Merton Street, legally described as Parcel 152-1 Section
M5; Part of Lot 152 s/s Merton Street, Plan M5 Toronto, City
of Toronto, being all of PIN 21123-0010 (LT); and Parcel 151-1
Section M5; Part of Lot 151 S/S Merton Street, Plan M5; Toronto,
City of Toronto, being all of PIN 21123-0011 (LT); and,


If acquired by the City, 267 Merton Street, legally described as
Parcel 2073 Section N; Part Lot 153 S/S Merton Street, Plan M5
Toronto, City of Toronto, being all of PIN 21123-0021 (LT).


The properties have a total area of approximately 2,201 m2
(23,690 ft2). 267 Merton Street is a residential property and
275 Merton Street is an existing Toronto Water office property.


The City proposes that the intended manner of disposal for the
properties is to be by way of a 99-year land lease to Markee
Missing Middle (Merton) Limited Partnership, for the purpose
of constructing purpose-built rental housing, including 30%
affordable rental units.


The following City official has information about the proposed
disposition: Mr. Eric Allen, Senior Project Manager, Tel:
416-392-1852, Metro Hall, 55 John Street, 2nd floor, Toronto,
Ontario M5V 3C6. Enquiries may be made of the said official
until June 25, 2024.
title: Declaration of Surplus Property - 275 Merton Street
topics: Sale of City Property/Real Estate > Proposed sale of City property
